org.mfg.mdb.runtime

Interface ISeqCursor<T extends IRecord>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The generated record class.
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable, ICursor<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Demo_02_PriceMDB.Cursor

    public interface ISeqCursor<T extends IRecord>
extends ICursor<T>
    Common interface for all sequential cursors.
    Author:
    arian

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      boolean next()
      Move the cursor to the next position.

    • Method Detail

      • next

        boolean next()
      throws java.io.IOException
        Move the cursor to the next position.
        Returns:
        true if there are more records.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is any problem reading the files.

      • reset

        void reset(long start,
           long stop)
    throws java.io.IOException

        Reset the cursor to retrieve the data from the start to the stop position.

        Use this method if you want to reuse the same cursor resources, actually we recommend to do that when possible. Internally MDB uses this method to reuse the cursors or the "select" methods.

        Very important, you cannot reset a closed cursor. Close a cursor when you will not use it anymore.

        Parameters:
        start - The cursor statrs here.
        stop - The cursor stops here.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is any problem accessing the files.
